Satya Yuga.name: Satya Yuga
Satya Yuga.symbolic_origin: Golden Age, Dharma stands on all four legs
Satya Yuga.role: Era of righteousness, spiritual wisdom, and harmony
Satya Yuga.time_reference: First of the four Yugas, lasting 1,728,000 years
Satya Yuga.label: Satya Yuga (Golden Age)

Treta Yuga.name: Treta Yuga
Treta Yuga.symbolic_origin: Silver Age, Dharma stands on three legs
Treta Yuga.role: Era of great kings and the Ramayana, decline in virtue
Treta Yuga.label: Treta Yuga (Silver Age)

Dwapara Yuga.name: Dwapara Yuga
Dwapara Yuga.symbolic_origin: Bronze Age, Dharma stands on two legs
Dwapara Yuga.role: Era of Mahabharata and Lord Krishna, further decline in virtue
Dwapara Yuga.label: Dwapara Yuga (Bronze Age)

Kali Yuga.name: Kali Yuga
Kali Yuga.symbolic_origin: Iron Age, Dharma stands on one leg
Kali Yuga.role: Current era, marked by spiritual decline and materialism
Kali Yuga.label: Kali Yuga (Iron Age)

Vedic period (developed fully in early c.name: Shiva
Vedic period (developed fully in early c.nature: Supreme deity in Shaivism, both destroyer and transformer within the Hindu Trimurti
Vedic period (developed fully in early c.symbolic_origin: Represents cosmic destruction and regeneration, beyond time and space
Vedic period (developed fully in early c.role: Embodiment of asceticism, meditation, and divine energy; worshiped as Mahadeva
Vedic period (developed fully in early c.time_reference: Prominent in Puranic era and integrated into Hindu philosophy
Vedic period (developed fully in early c.label: Shiva (Hindu deity, Vedic roots)

Unknown.name: Lord Vishnu
Unknown.symbolic_origin: Cosmic ocean (Ksheer Sagara), resting on Ananta Shesha
Unknown.role: Preserver, sustainer, manifests in avatars to restore dharma
Unknown.time_reference: Appears in every Yuga through incarnations
Unknown.label: Lord Vishnu (Timeless)

Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE), promi.name: Vishnu
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE), promi.nature: Preserver and protector of the universe, supreme deity in Vaishnavism
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE), promi.symbolic_origin: Embodies cosmic order, sustenance, and dharma
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE), promi.role: Maintains balance of creation, incarnates as avatars (e.g., Rama, Krishna) to restore dharma
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE), promi.time_reference: Vedic roots, fully developed in Puranic texts
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE), promi.label: Vishnu (Hindu deity, Vedic roots)

Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE).name: Brahman
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE).nature: Infinite, formless, eternal, and ultimate reality in Hindu philosophy
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE).symbolic_origin: Uncreated, beyond time, space, and attributes
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE).role: Supreme cosmic principle, source of all existence, described in the Upanishads
Vedic period (circa 1500–500 BCE).label: Brahman (Hindu concept, Vedic period)

Matsya.name: Matsya
Matsya.role: Saved the Vedas and humanity from deluge
Matsya.label: Matsya (Fish Avatar)

Kurma.name: Kurma
Kurma.role: Supported Mount Mandara during churning of the ocean
Kurma.label: Kurma (Tortoise Avatar)

Narasimha.name: Narasimha
Narasimha.role: Destroyed demon Hiranyakashipu to protect devotee Prahlada
Narasimha.label: Narasimha (Man-Lion Avatar)

Vamana.name: Vamana
Vamana.symbolic_origin: Symbol of humility and cosmic balance
Vamana.role: Subdued demon king Bali by covering universe in three steps
Vamana.time_reference: Transition from Satya to Treta Yuga (symbolic)
Vamana.label: Vamana (Dwarf Avatar)

Parashurama.name: Parashurama
Parashurama.role: Destroyed corrupt Kshatriyas to restore balance
Parashurama.label: Parashurama (Warrior Avatar)

Krishna.name: Krishna
Krishna.symbolic_origin: Symbol of love, wisdom, and cosmic play
Krishna.role: Guided Arjuna in Bhagavad Gita, destroyed evil forces
Krishna.label: Krishna (Divine Avatar)

Buddha.name: Buddha
Buddha.role: Taught path of peace and renunciation era
Buddha.label: Buddha (Teacher Avatar)

Kalki.name: Kalki
Kalki.role: Will appear at end of Kali Yuga to destroy evil
Kalki.time_reference: Predicted ~427,000 years from now (end of Kali Yuga)
Kalki.label: Kalki (Future Avatar)

Lord Rama.name: Lord Rama
Lord Rama.symbolic_origin: Born in Ayodhya to King Dasharatha and Queen Kausalya
Lord Rama.role: Embodiment of dharma, ideal king, hero of Ramayana
Lord Rama.label: Lord Rama (Treta Yuga)

Lord Krishna.name: Lord Krishna
Lord Krishna.symbolic_origin: Born in Mathura to Vasudeva and Devaki
Lord Krishna.role: Teacher of Bhagavad Gita, divine strategist, embodiment of love
Lord Krishna.label: Lord Krishna (Dwapara Yuga)

Vyasa.name: Vyasa
Vyasa.nature: Compiler of Vedas and author of Mahabharata
Vyasa.symbolic_origin: Embodies wisdom, knowledge, and preservation of dharma
Vyasa.role: Composed Mahabharata, compiled Vedas, authored Puranas
Vyasa.label: Vyasa (Hindu sage, Vedic roots)

Valmiki.name: Valmiki
Valmiki.role: Composed Ramayana, revered as Adi Kavi (first poet)
Valmiki.label: Valmiki (Hindu sage, Vedic roots)

Agastya.name: Agastya
Agastya.nature: Sage known for wisdom and spreading Vedic knowledge to South India
Agastya.symbolic_origin: Symbol of balance and cultural integration
Agastya.role: Composed hymns in Rigveda, introduced Vedic culture to southern regions
Agastya.label: Agastya (Hindu sage, Vedic roots)

Narada.name: Narada
Narada.role: Acts as celestial messenger, spreads knowledge and devotion
Narada.time_reference: Appears in Vedas, Mahabharata, Ramayana, and Puranas
Narada.label: Narada (Hindu sage, Vedic roots)

Durga.name: Durga
Durga.symbolic_origin: Represents divine feminine power and protection
Durga.role: Defeated demon Mahishasura, protector of dharma
Durga.label: Durga (Hindu goddess, Puranic roots)

Lakshmi.name: Lakshmi
Lakshmi.nature: Goddess of wealth, prosperity, and fortune
Lakshmi.role: Consort of Vishnu, bestows wealth and well-being
Lakshmi.label: Lakshmi (Hindu goddess, Puranic roots)

Saraswati.name: Saraswati
Saraswati.nature: Goddess of wisdom, learning, and arts
Saraswati.role: Associated with Vedas, music, and education
Saraswati.time_reference: Prominent in Puranas and Vedic hymns
Saraswati.label: Saraswati (Hindu goddess, Vedic roots)

Subramanya (Kartikeya, Murugan).name: Subramanya (Kartikeya, Murugan)
Subramanya (Kartikeya, Murugan).nature: God of war and victory, son of Shiva and Parvati
Subramanya (Kartikeya, Murugan).symbolic_origin: Embodies courage, wisdom, and divine leadership
Subramanya (Kartikeya, Murugan).role: Commander of the celestial army, protector of dharma, revered especially in South India
Subramanya (Kartikeya, Murugan).time_reference: Prominent in Skanda Purana and Tamil Sangam literature
Subramanya (Kartikeya, Murugan).label: Subramanya Swami (Hindu deity, Puranic roots)

Ganesha.name: Ganesha
Ganesha.nature: Remover of obstacles, god of beginnings
Ganesha.role: Invoked before any new venture, son of Shiva and Parvati
Ganesha.time_reference: Prominent in Puranas and devotional traditions
Ganesha.label: Ganesha (Hindu deity, Puranic roots)

Early Civilization.name: Early Civilization
Early Civilization.role: Foundation of human society, start of organized communities
Early Civilization.label: EBC (Estimated Beginning of Civilization)

Vedic Period.name: Vedic Period
Vedic Period.nature: Development of spiritual and philosophical texts
Vedic Period.role: Rise of early Indian civilization, formation of rituals and social order
Vedic Period.label: Vedic Period

Buddha & Mahavira.name: Buddha & Mahavira
Buddha & Mahavira.nature: Spiritual leaders and founders of Buddhism and Jainism
Buddha & Mahavira.role: Spread of non-violence, meditation, and renunciation
Buddha & Mahavira.label: Buddha & Mahavira

Gupta Empire.name: Gupta Empire
Gupta Empire.role: Advances in science, mathematics, arts, and literature
Gupta Empire.label: Gupta Empire

Delhi Sultanate.name: Delhi Sultanate
Delhi Sultanate.symbolic_origin: Establishment after the Battle of Tarain
Delhi Sultanate.role: Cultural and architectural transformation, introduction of new governance
Delhi Sultanate.label: Delhi Sultanate

Mughal Empire.name: Mughal Empire
Mughal Empire.role: Unification of large parts of India, flourishing of art and architecture
Mughal Empire.label: Mughal Empire

British Rule Begins.name: British Rule Begins
British Rule Begins.nature: Colonial rule by the British Empire
British Rule Begins.role: Economic and social transformation, resistance and reform movements
British Rule Begins.label: British Rule Begins

Indian Independence.name: Indian Independence
Indian Independence.nature: End of colonial rule, birth of a nation
Indian Independence.role: Formation of a sovereign democratic republic
Indian Independence.label: Indian Independence

Republic of India.name: Republic of India
Republic of India.nature: Adoption of the Constitution of India
Republic of India.role: Establishment of democratic governance and fundamental rights
Republic of India.label: Republic of India

Present Day.name: Present Day
Present Day.nature: Modern India: technology, economy, and culture
Present Day.role: Global presence, innovation, and cultural continuity
Present Day.label: Present Day
